title: The Circle: Paddy tears up as he confides in Georgina about his cerebral palsy
text:
Paddy and Georgina get emotional (Picture: Channel 4)

Newcomer to The Circle, Paddy, just opened up to Georgina about his cerebral palsy and fans can’t handle how emotional the conversation got.

It all came about after contestants began playing a game called Paddy’s Picks, where they are given a theme and can select a photo from their private albums to match it, before Paddy decides which player’s picture was best.

In one of the categories, called No Filter, Georgina – who has Crohn’s – ends up sharing a photo of herself in a hospital bed.

Paddy remarks: ‘It takes courage to put a picture like that up.’

Later in the episode, he decides to start a private chat with Georgina to tell her that very sentiment.

He tells Georgina: ‘I think we could have a lot in common in terms of obstacles we’ve had to overcome. That picture you posted last night of you in the hospital was brave.’

Paddy is then unsure whether or not to open up about his own disability, but decides to in the end.

Georgina in hospital bed (Picture: Channel 4)

He continues: ‘I know how hard it is to talk about your condition when people ask. I know this because I have cerebral palsy in my legs. I haven’t told people yet but felt I could trust you with this.’

Georgina is taken aback by the revelation, as Paddy hasn’t previously chosen to share any photos clearly showing his cerebral palsy to the group.

They both start crying.

She messages back: ‘May I ask why you feel you want to hide it from the group? It can remain our secret, but I don’t want you to feel like it’s something that you have to keep quiet.’

Paddy responds: ‘It’s not that I’m ashamed or scared. It’s that I wanted to feel what it would be like for once to just be me and not be “that disabled guy”‘.

That was such a powerful conversation!

*Sends Paddy and Georgina a virtual hug* #TheCircle pic.twitter.com/NWRe3pSmki — The Circle (@C4TheCircle) October 6, 2019

Fans immediately took to social media to share how emotional watching the scene made them.

One tweeted: ‘I cried when he told Georgina about his disability. When are humans gonna stop labelling each other and just see everyone as equal humans?’

While another wrote: ‘Absolutely loved that chat between Georgina and Paddy, and the reason why this show is so different from Big Brother. When you are not face to face, it can lead to the best conversations because you are genuinely being yourselves.’

Then another tweeted: ‘Genuinely powerful discussion of the Patient Experience of Georgina’s Crohns & Paddy’s Cerebral Palsy.’

The Circle continues Monday at 10pm on Channel 4.
